oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saber and scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Saber and scabbard, European-manufactured, possibly French. The scabbard has been broken and repaired. The blade is etched with a sun and moon. According to family tradition, the saber was given to Baker Franklin Ault for allowing a Civil War unit to stop and rest on his farm. It is unknown if the unit was Union or Confederate.
